text: Sasthibrata Chakravarti (1939–2015), known as Sasthi Brata, was a British- Indian Indo-Anglian writer of fiction. He is best known for his best selling novel Confessions of an Indian Woman Eater. ==Early life and education== Sasthibrata was educated at Calcutta Boys' School, Kolkata and then at Presidency College, Kolkata, then affiliated with the University of Calcutta. ==Post literary career== Sasthibrata lived a checkered life. After his literary career, he had worked as a salesman for air conditioners, a lavatory attendant, a postman, a kitchen porter, to supplement his pension. Rebel at seventy-one - Eternal quest of a thinking mind He died in 2015 at the age of 75. ==Bibliography== * My God Died Young * Confessions of an Indian Woman Eater * India: Labyrinths in the Lotus Land * Traitor to India: A search for home * India: The Perpetual Paradox ==References== Category:British people of Bengali descent Category:Indian emigrants to England Category:Bengali writers Category:Indian male novelists Category:Writers from Kolkata Category:Presidency University, Kolkata alumni Category:University of Calcutta alumni Category:1939 births Category:2015 deaths Category:20th-century Indian novelists Category:Novelists from West Bengal Category:20th-century Indian male writers
